medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent diarrhea, abdominal distension, and perianal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced recurrent diarrhea for the past 10 years. Recently, he has had frequent diarrhea occurring five to six times per day, with yellow, loose, or watery stools. He also developed abdominal distension, weight loss, and dull pain in the posterior lateral muscle group of the left thigh, which affects his walking. The day before seeking medical attention, he developed a fever.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a 10-year history of recurrent diarrhea and has undergone multiple surgeries at other hospitals.
